Ideally, we would like to construct a spread by purchasing options which are underpriced and selling options which are overpriced. If we can do this the resulting spread, whatever its type, will always have a positive theoretical edge. More often, however, our opinion about volatility will result in all options appear- ing either underpriced or overpriced.
